Curt Sampson wrote:

> On Sat, 10 Jul 2004, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> 
>  > ....then write one test called "testDatabaseConnection()". If that
>  > fails, then the rest is self-evident.
> 
> Right. But the problem is finding that one important failure in the list
> of 250 failures that you got from your test run.

To me, that sounds like a test results filtering problem, so I would put 
my attention there for a simple solution. An XSL stylesheet that looks 
for that one test result and highlights failures in big, bold red 
letters would be easy (we know how to do it), and effective, if not perfect.
